summary: COVID-19 led to food supply disruptions. In response, the U.S. Department of Agriculture began buying about $3 billion in fruits, vegetables, dairy products, and meat; packaging the food in family-sized boxes; and transporting it to food banks and other organizations within weeks. The USDA delivered more than 74 million boxes from May 15 to Aug 27. The USDA divided the initial funding into three rounds...
title: Agriculture Spending: Opportunities Exist for USDA to Identify Successes and Challenges of the Farmers to Families Food Box Program to Inform Future Efforts
